course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Video Art
course.description: Video Art is an art form combined varies medium, moving images, sound, and multimedia elements. This special art form involves experimentation, concept implementation and editing. In the course, we will explore varies camera skills, and explore styles and concept. Through explorations and practices to achieve certain features and concepts of video art.

reviews.author: outofthisworld
reviews.title: Only enroll if u think u are professional
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fine.

1. Introduction to video art
- gerne of video art
- intro to a crew
- some samples
2. Filming
- equipment
- different angles and distances of shots
3. ... (I dont quite rmb and the ppt is not all there)

Ppt is brief and that will not help u much on making ur video, just really get to know about video art.
reviews.comment_teaching:
1 lesson per week, 2 hrs 50 mins

The content he taught definitely do not worth 3 hrs but he take attendance so u must go

Being late or leaving early for more than 10 minutes twice will be counted as one absence so u can't even be late

There is a course schedule in the syllabus but then for the first few lesson he keeps changing it without telling us. We only know the schedule was changed when we arrive there.
The schedule is important because there are some lessons like practical workshops that require u to bring ur camera and tripod.

He loves to talk about something that i think not quite related and he loves to talk about himself. I would not say that is bad as that's how I make through that 3 hrs. Just see if u can accept that.

There are non-local students who really don't understand Cantonese. Prof said he will be teaching in English and tell those students don't be worry. However I am going to say his English is not quite good and he always use Hong Kong movie and directors as examples, I don't think those non-local students would understand. Also, he automatically change to Cantonese when he is excited in talking about something he familiar or love, that's quite unfriendly to non-local students.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Attendance
30% Midterm Project (Individual)
40% Final Project (Group project)
20% Learning Portfolio

None of the score was disclosed. All u need to do is guess ur performance by his comment when u present.

I attended all lessons and 1 was late. I think I did ok in midterm and learning portfolio but did a terrible job in final. At last I got a C+.
My friend in class did a little worse in midterm and better in learning portfolio, in the same group with me in final but she got B-.

There are youtubers and bloggers in the class who made really great videos and got praised by the whole class. Prof shown complete bias on them in class so I can't say this course is friendly to newbies.
reviews.comment_workload:
Super super super heavy workload (in my point of view)

First, this is not a video editing course. This course is about producing a video by urself.
A complete process of making a video should be
1. expending ur idea (mind map)
2. imagine the shots u want to take and arrange them (storyboard)
3. go take ur shots
4. edit ur shots
All of these things are required plus a written statement in this course. (once for midterm and once for final)

Details for midterm:
1 min video to present urself
600 words written statement
A mind map
A storyboard
5 mins presentation (actually is must longer as he will ask you questions afterwards)
deadline was quite near my midterms

he did said he will teach us to do the mind map and storyboard in the course schedule so u will want to wait till he show u the samples in lessons. It is quite late if u start to do ur video when him finish teaching all the related content as that is the midterm period.

Details for final (gp project with 3-4 students a gp):
3-5 min video to show the best side of Hong Kong
1000 words written statement
research works
A storyboard
5 mins presentation
Deadline was right before sem end

DO MAKE FRIENDS IN CLASS! u don't want to wait till he make a gp for u.
This is a huge project, if u want to do great, start early.

Details for learning portfolio:
not quite clear
"observations, inspirations, and ideas on the assignments (eg, brainstorming / free drawings/ draft) and research that came across during the semester" this is what was written in the syllabus.
he suggest making at least 2 pages per week and he want pictures for illustration too, so u better push urself to done that each week as the deadline for this is only a week before the final project. Don't think u will have enough time to do that by one week as u still have other courses.


I am quite sure this course bring hard time for many ppl in the course:
somebody did late drop before midterm project
somebody were credit overloading to do this course (21/24 credits)
some newbies need to learn all things about making a video in about a month

So guys better assess urself before enrolling in this course, u need a very good time management skill.

reviews.author: hatsunemiku
reviews.title: Worse course, extremely heavy workload
reviews.comment_content:
Presentations.........and presentations
You only learn some basic filming skills in the first lesson, then........just presentations!!!

The syllabus is very unclear and the assignment's instructions are very poor delivered.
Contents are barely relevant to photography, it has outing but he teaches nothing, just telling us to take photos, thats all.

Ah he also told us we can borrow a camera from school's library but it is only available for staff :)
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching using Cantonese most of the times so that the international students won't understand. PowerPoint slides are messy and poor organised. His lecturers are really boring like 拖時間. He also got mad at someone didn't have a group member although they didn't want to.
